intro: Fedia sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian fedia, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the island of Sicily. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Fedia sicula thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in limestone-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
